Cryptography & certificates\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The Cryptographic Controls Standard must be adhered to in addition to the requirements below.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1 Cryptography\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1.1 Well established, industrial strength techniques must be used for encryption.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1.2 Asymmetric encryption algorithms (RSA or a comparable) must be used with the minimum key length of 2048 bits; a minimum of 4096 bits should be used.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1.3 Symmetric encryption algorithms (AES or a comparable) must be used with the minimum key length of 128 bits; a minimum of 256 bits should be used.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1.4 SHA-2 or a stronger one-way transformation algorithm (such as PBKDF2 or Argon2 must be used for hashing authentication data.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1.5 SHA-1 or a stronger one-way transformation algorithm must be used for hashing non-authentication data.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1.6 Cryptographic mechanisms used for storing personal or sensitive data must be implemented on the server side.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.1.7 The server must not allow insecure re-negotiation or down-grading of insecure TLS cipher suites. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.2 Certificates\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.2.1 Verification of both client and server certificate chains must be included in the system design and implementation.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.2.2 Certificates must only be accepted during their validity period (according to the values of Not Before and Not After fields).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.2.3 Certificates used for digital signature must differ from certificates used for SSL/TLS transport encryption.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"10.2.4 Private and public key pairs used in TLS must have Enhanced Key Usage limited to Server Authentication or Client Authentication and must not be used as Certification Authorities. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
